v.v: Behold, my servant, whom I uphold; my chosen one, in him I take delight.
He will not cry out nor shout, nor make his voice heard in the streets.
A crushed reed he will not break, and a dimly burning wick he will not quench:
He will not grow faint nor be discouraged
This is what God Yahweh says—
“I, Yahweh, have called you in righteousness and will hold your hand.
to open the eyes of the blind, to release the prisoners from the dungeon,
I am Yahweh, that is my name;
See, the previous things came to pass,
Sing to Yahweh a new song, and his praise from the end of the earth;
Let the desert and the cities cry out,
Let them give glory to Yahweh and declare his praise in the coastlands.
Yahweh will go out as a warrior; as a man of war he will stir up his zeal.
I have kept quiet for a long time; I have been still and restrained myself;
I will lay waste mountains and hills and dry up all their vegetation;
I will bring the blind by a way that they do not know; in paths that they do not know I will lead them.
They will be turned back, they will be completely put to shame, those who trust in carved figures,
Listen, you deaf; and look, you blind, that you may see.
Who is blind but my servant? Or deaf like my messenger I send?
You see many things, but do not comprehend; ears are open, but no one hears.
It pleased Yahweh to praise his justice and to make his law glorious.
But this is a people robbed and plundered;
Who among you will listen to this? Who will listen and hear in the future?
Who gave Jacob over to the robber, and Israel to the looters?
Therefore he poured out on them his fierce anger and the violence of war,

v: I have put my Spirit upon him; he will bring justice to the nations.
he will faithfully execute justice.
until he has established justice on the earth;
and the coastlands wait for his law.
the one who created the heavens and stretched them out, the one who made the earth and all that it produces,
the one who gives breath to the people on it and life to those who live on it:
I will keep you and set you as a covenant for the people, as a light for the Gentiles,
and from the house of confinement those who sit in darkness.
and my glory I will not share with another nor my praise with carved idols.
now I am about to declare new events.
Before they begin to occur I will tell you about them.”
you who go down to the sea, and all that is
Let the inhabitants of Sela sing; let them shout from the mountaintops.
He will shout, yes, he will roar his battle cries; he will show his enemies his power.
now I will cry out like a woman in labor; I will gasp and pant.
and I will turn the rivers into islands and will dry up the marshes.
I will turn the darkness into light before them, and make the crooked places straight.
These things I will do, and I will not abandon them.
who say to cast metal figures, “You are our gods.”
Who is as blind as my covenant partner, or blind as Yahweh’s servant?
they are all trapped in pits, held captive in prisons;
they have become a plunder with no one to rescue them, and no one says, “Bring them back!”
Was it not Yahweh, against whom we have sinned,
in whose ways they refused to walk, and whose law they refused to obey?
Its flames encircled them, yet they did not understand;
it consumed them, but they did not take it to heart.
